title: Was Marie Curie the first woman scientist? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, not by a long shot. here are a few that predate her, in some cases by centuries: Maria Sybilla Merian (1647–1717, a “naturalist”), Emilie du Châtelet (1706–1749), Sophie Germain (1776–1831), Sofia Wassilijewna Kowaleskaja (1850–1891) (all mathematicians), Laura Bassi (physicist, 1711–1778), Caroline Herschel (1750–1848, astronomy), Maria Margaretha Kirch (1670–1720, astronomy) Going further back: Hildegard von Bingen (1098–1179, early medicine and botanist) And then there are those who might or might not have existed, like Maria Prophetissima (1 century AD). And those are only the ones we know about. Do we know who discovered fermentation, the raising power of yeast, the sterilizing power of sugar? Most likely those who did the cooking and thus most likely women.
